required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Project EV Minus Regulatory Clinical Evaluation - System Accuracy, User Performance and System Use Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Project EV Minus Regulatory Clinical Evaluation - System Accuracy, User Performance and System Use Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical Evaluation including System Accuracy, User Performance and System Use Evaluation of a new Blood Glucose Monitoring System.

primary_outcome.measure: User Performance (UP) evaluation - blood glucose level: BGMS vs reference instrument.
primary_outcome.description: UP evaluation of blood glucose monitoring systems compared to a reference instrument. Samples collected by subject and HCP ( HealthCare Professional)

primary_outcome.measure: System Accuracy (SA) evaluation - blood glucose level: BGMS vs reference instrument.
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy verification of blood glucose monitoring systems compared to a reference instrument. Samples collected by HCP only.

primary_outcome.measure: System Use Evaluation - HCP ( HealthCare Professional) questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Assessing use of BGMS and supporting material by subject.

arm_group.description: Intervention: Blood Glucose monitoring System (BGMS) Results obtained from the BGMS for UP and SA are compared to a reference instrument (YSI)

criteria.textblock:
Summary of Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to voluntarily provide written informed consent to participate in the study.
- User Performance Accuracy Testing Only: Self-Monitoring - Subject is currently performing unassisted self-monitoring of blood glucose.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects who are pregnant or lactating.
- Subjects who, in the opinion of the Investigator, are unsuitable for participation in the study.
- User Performance Accuracy Testing Only -Prior involvement with the investigational BGMS being used in this study.
